question_text: A refurbished laptop frequently fails to boot after replacing its original 2.5 inch drive. Select two plausible causes based on drive replacement procedures.
answer_options: Drive was installed without its bracket
Drive was not securely screwed into position
Access panel was replaced with third-party plastic
BIOS boot order still points to the old drive
correct_answer: Drive was not securely screwed into position
BIOS boot order still points to the old drive
explanation: Loose mounting can cause disconnection, and BIOS might still default to a missing or removed boot device.
